class.name: Software Design
class.description: The course will include lectures on the following topics: Basic UML models and modeling, Categories, Refactorings, Object Oriented Design Patterns, Architectural Patterns, Incremental Design of Architectures, Service Oriented Architectures, and (if there is time) Software Product Lines. And of course, concepts from MDE which all of the above are seen as special cases.

class.name: Computational Intelligence in Game Design I
class.description: Students will become familiar with next-generation AI techniques that may play a central role in the next generation of video games and learn hands-on about working with modern game engines. The students will work in teams toward original research projects aiming to improve the state of the art of AI in games as well as to contribute to an active open source project.

class.name: Neural Networks
class.description: The main goals of the class are to (1) obtain an overview of current state of the art in the field, (2) carry out a substantial research project, and (3) get practice in research skills such as conducting a literature study, putting together a research and a conference talk, and writing a research paper. The course is organized so that selecting and completing a research project should be as easy as possible.
